result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. May not go into any bars.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with S.R. (person, property, residence or family). May not possess any weapons. Comply with family court order. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Counseling and cognitive therapy as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Nicholas D Koenig in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Dirk Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
Count 1- 1 Year RCJ, i/s, 1 Year Probation

Conditions:
60 days RCJ
Huber for work & childcare
May not possess any weapons
no drugs, no alcohol - may not go into any bars
AODA assessment
No contact with S.R.
Engage in counseling 
Comply with family court order
Cognitive therapy if deemed appropriate
Complete 20 hours of community service work
Provide a DNA Sample + pay surcharge
Court costs are waived
FAW
